text: For us is the same, when you have a multilanguage site, it would be helpful this takes multilanguage in consideration with system pages for each

Not a big expert on accessibility, but W3's WAI guide specifies that:

>The `<fieldset>` element provides a container for related form controls.

Source: <https://www.w3.org/WAI/tutorials/forms/grouping/>

In the use cases that I've seen the HubSpot forms `<fieldset>` is only used as a way to layout the form fields into columns, regardless of whether the fields are actually related to each other or not. So even if there's an accessibility benefit to `<fieldset>`, I don't think it's actually used properly in the HS forms markup? :slightly_smiling_face:

Anyways, from the link above it seems that you can use `<div role="group">` to accomplish the same thing as `<fieldset>` does.

I'm afraid short of them maybe implementing lazyloading for images within blog post content and featured images on listing pages, they probably won't implement a lazy load across the board, as there are numerous ways to do lazyloading and some websites have simpler or more complex needs regarding lazyloading

As a developer while I see the value in this, I personally would rather have control over the lazyloading, which in the end means I'd need to find my own lazyloading script online, of which there are many.

If they implement this I really hope they'd make it an Opt In type change, as well as have an api to be able to use it within custom modules and whatnot.

It would be great if there was a parameter you could add to modules to group them for editing content at the page level.  Something along the lines of `module_group="name of group of modules"`.  That way you could keep modules that are set to `export_to_template_context=True` grouped with other modules that occur in the same section of the page as well as just generally providing a more user friendly experience.

im late, but some weeks ago we talk with some of you guys about this REALLY BIG ISSUE: analytics per domain on enterprise. we have, at least, 8 domains but we only can track 3. that is nonsense for us.
we use IDs for that. And when create custom modules we use a custom field to create that id per module
